control.name: Where passwords are entered on a UI, the actual pass phrase is obscured by default
control.desc:
Where passwords are entered on a user interface, the actual pass phrase is obscured by default.

Rationale:
 Password masking is the practice of obscuring the password characters when entered on a user interface, more often behind bullets (Â·), asterisks (*) or similar camouflaging characters. The idea behind password masking is primarily the protection against "shoulder surfing", in other words to prevent nearby observers reading the password "over the user's shoulder" and thus stolen, which is crucial for mobile devices. A second reason is to obscure the password in cases of shared screens, projectors, etc.

Remediation:
 Ensure that the actual pass phrase is obscured by default where entered on a user interface.
